question.name: Question 1
question.text: Fill in the blank. An HSR is a who is elected from among a designated group of workers.

question.name: Question 2
question.text: WHS laws impose certain obligations on PCBUs to HSRs. True or false?

question.name: Question 3
question.text: What powers does an HSR have?
question.choices: Monitoring measures taken by the PCBU to comply with WHS laws|Investigating complaints from workers concerning work health and safety|Representing workers of their workgroup in work health and safety matters|All of the above

question.name: Question 4
question.text: Which of the following are powers of an HSR?
question.choices: Request information about workers\u2019 work health and safety|Inspect the workplace|Direct a worker to cease work in certain circumstances|All of the above

question.name: Question 5
question.text: Fill in the blank. HSRs may issue a(n) to any person they reasonably believe is contravening WHS laws.
question.choices: \u2026 undertaking\u2026|\u2026 fine\u2026|\u2026 provisional improvement notice\u2026|None of the above

question.name: Question 6
question.text: What is an HSR personally liable for?
question.choices: Any type of function they perform at the workplace, regardless of whether it is WHS-related|Any omission in the performance of their job|An HSR is always personally liable for their actions|All of the above

question.name: Question 7
question.correctans: \u2026 owes several obligations to an HSR
question.choices: \u2026 has no obligations to an HSR|\u2026 owes several obligations to an HSR|\u2026 only owes an obligation to not dismiss an HSR for performing his or her work|\u2026 has no additional obligations to an HSR besides the ones it owes all of its workers

question.name: Question 8
question.text: If an HSR requests to attend an approved WHS training course what must the PCBU do?
question.correctans: Grant the HSR leave to complete the course, and pay the HSR\u2019s course fees and regular income
question.choices: Grant the HSR leave to complete the course, and pay the HSR\u2019s course fees and regular income|Grant the HSR leave to complete the course, but the HSR must pay for the course|Consider whether to permit the HSR to attend|Refuse the request, as an HSR is not allowed to be absent from the workplace for a prolonged period of time

question.name: Question 9
question.text: Which obligation does a PCBU owe to an HSR?
question.choices: To consult with the HSR, so far as reasonably practicable, on any work health and safety matter|To grant the HSR access to information relating to any possible risks to workers in their workgroup|To provide the HSR with resources that are reasonably necessary for the HSR to perform their functions|All of the above

question.name: Question 10
question.text: Fill in the blank. A health and safety committee facilitates cooperation between ________ in workplace health and safety matters.
question.choices: \u2026 the PCBU and customers\u2026|\u2026 the government and workers\u2026|\u2026 the PCBU and workers\u2026|\u2026 customers and workers\u2026

question.name: Question 11
question.text: If a valid request is made for a health and safety committee, when must the PCBU establish the committee?
question.choices: Within 14 days|Within two months|At a date specified by the workers|As soon as reasonably practicable

question.name: Question 12
question.text: What must a PCBU allow members of the health and safety committee to do?
question.correctans: Spend as much time as necessary, and within reason, to meet and perform their functions
question.choices: Spend as much time as necessary, and within reason, to meet and perform their functions|Decide whether or not to wear the company uniform|Raise their level of pay|Have one day off each week to have a committee meeting

question.name: Question 13
question.text: Except in Queensland, what is a WHS entry permit holder permitted to do?
question.correctans: Enter a workplace without notice if they are investigating a suspected WHS breach that relates to workers who are members of that union (or are eligible to be)
question.choices: Consult and advise workers on salary negotiations|Enter a workplace with seven days\u2019 notice to investigate a suspected WHS breach|Enter a workplace without notice if they are investigating a suspected WHS breach that relates to workers who are members of that union (or are eligible to be)|Investigate a suspected breach of WHS laws that affects union members only

question.name: Question 14
question.text: A WHS entry permit holder or authorised representative of a registered organisation can only be refused entry to a workplace with a reasonable excuse. True or false?

question.name: Question 15
question.text: What is a WHS entry permit holder NOT permitted to do when entering a workplace?
question.correctans: Suspend all work at the workplace for any reason, at any time
question.choices: Inspect any part of the workplace, plant, substance or structure that is directly relevant to the suspected contravention|Consult with workers who are members of the union (or eligible to be) in relation to the suspected contravention|Suspend all work at the workplace for any reason, at any time|View and copy any documents held by the PCBU that are directly relevant to the contravention, as long as the documents are not employee records
